channel.title: Got one error trying to replace Boolean
channel.description:
[spoiler][img]http://i.imgur.com/MCCpr7q.png[/img] [img]http://i.imgur.com/Bx3VcSr.png[/img][/spoiler]
need help replacing the Boolean not sure how to do it tho it is a 667 and i am trying to make a pk system for my spawn server any help would be great thank you -calem

item.title: Got one error trying to replace Boolean
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:14, topic:548878”][quote author=suseto link=topic=667786.msg4465992#msg4465992 date=1420172177]
sk8rdude461 that compiled just fine but it was unsuccessful in making items unspawnable.
[/quote]
That is because you are using the item ID’s in your command and names in the unspawnable list. Make Settings.UNSPAWNABLE contain the item IDs, not the item names.[/quote]
Or, alternatively, (since there are multiple items with the same name) you could get the item name from the item defs.
and you could change it from equalsIgnoreCase to contains, so it checks for ones with (n) in it.

Read full topic
item.source: Got one error trying to replace Boolean

item.title: Got one error trying to replace Boolean
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

suseto:

sk8rdude461 that compiled just fine but it was unsuccessful in making items unspawnable.

That is because you are using the item ID’s in your command and names in the unspawnable list. Make Settings.UNSPAWNABLE contain the item IDs, not the item names.

Read full topic

item.title: Got one error trying to replace Boolean
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

The code provided doesn’t match the error shown in the picture.

As you see here, there are quotes around the text, thus making it a STRING.

But if you look here. NO QUOTES.

[quote=“suseto, post:8, topic:548878”]here is the public stating string I added into settings.java
public static String[] UNSPAWNABLE_ITEMS = {“dharok”, “ahrim’s”, “bandos”, “armadyl”, “karil’s”, “polypore staff”, “divine spirit shield”, “elysian spirit shield”, “spectral spirit shield”, “drygore”, “boogie bow”, “arcane spirit shield”, “doomed”, “partyhat”, “santa hat”, “h’ween mask”, “dragon claws”, “dark bow”, “dragon defender”, “wings”, “vesta’s”, “statius’s”, “morrigan’s”, “vote box”, “chaotic”, “goliath”, “steadfast”, “glaiven”, “ragefire”, “zuriel’s”, “korasi’s sword”, “pk ticket”, “saradomin”, “zamorak”, “masamune”, “abyssal”, };

what would the string boolean whatever its called to make the exception so the listed items would no longer be spawnable[/quote]
Something like this would work…

public boolean itemEquals(String item) {// ;) for(String itemCheck : Settings.UNSPAWNABLE) if(item.equalsIgnoreCase(itemCheck)) return true return false }

Read full topic

item.title: Got one error trying to replace Boolean
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

What are settings.UNSPAWNABLE? Is it a list/array? If so, check if the list contain the item ID from the command. Use Java Documentation if you don’t know how to find out if a list or an array contain a certain item.

Read full topic

item.title: Got one error trying to replace Boolean
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

Why doesn’t the line from the error message match the line in the code? Before you mess with someone else’s code, look at what the code is doing. If you don’t even know what that line is supposed to do, you shouldn’t have changed and broken it.

item.title: Got one error trying to replace Boolean

item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

"We need help converting the string to a boolean."
Seriously, do you know anything about programming? You cannot just convert a string into a bool value, and you give no clue about what you’re trying to do or even give us the right part of the code, we can’t help you. And please tell me that you’re using an IDE and not Notepad++.
